page.title: 10RECREATION RIDING MK WESTON
page.content: Shortgrove Lane is an unmetalled road (bridle path) between Market Weston & Hopton that provides access for farm vehicles to the small fields on either side.These fields are generally culti- vated for cereal crops but one has veg- etables & two railway trucks as sheds. In summer the banks are overgrown with grass & wild flowers. At the Hopton end are an old cottage and three modern houses, one with a huge garden with model railway track. Near Market Weston there is a row of 10 trees. The lane is used by people walking and horseriding or, occasionally, on motor- cycles. This is a favourite place for horseriding (a pastime in the area) and one of the few where a horse can have a good gallop.
